duplicates.removed_title: China reviews Meta’s $2bn purchase of AI start-up Manus
duplicates.duplicate_of_title: Manus–Meta Deal May Come Under Scrutiny From Beijing: Report
duplicates.reason: Both articles cover the same specific news event: Meta's $2 billion acquisition of AI startup Manus coming under Chinese regulatory review. The articles report on the same deal from different angles (Financial Times reporting the review, Analytics India Mag providing context on why Beijing might scrutinize it).

duplicates.removed_title: MiniMax’s Hong Kong IPO Oversubscribed 1,848 Times as AI Frenzy Builds
duplicates.duplicate_of_title: MiniMax超额认购1209倍，1月9日正式上市
duplicates.reason: Both articles cover the same MiniMax Hong Kong IPO event on January 6, 2026. While they report slightly different oversubscription figures (1,848x vs 1,209x), this appears to be due to different measurement points in the IPO process (retail vs total subscriptions). They are reporting on the same specific corporate event.

duplicates.removed_title: Nvidia's AI driving tech to debut in Mercedes CLA in 2026
duplicates.duplicate_of_title: NVIDIA DRIVE AV Software Makes Production Debut in New Mercedes-Benz CLA
duplicates.reason: Both articles report the same announcement: Nvidia's autonomous driving technology (Alpamayo/DRIVE AV) making its production debut in the Mercedes-Benz CLA in 2026. They cover the identical partnership and timeline, just with slightly different technical terminology and emphasis.

duplicates.removed_title: Alexa+ comes for ChatGPT's web turf
duplicates.duplicate_of_title: Amazon’s AI assistant comes to the web with Alexa.com
duplicates.reason: Both articles report the same news event: Amazon launching Alexa.com (and revamped Alexa mobile app) with its Alexa+ AI assistant as a web-based interface. They cover the same product launch with similar details about integrations and capabilities, published within one day of each other.
